intro: Valerianella microcarpa, commonly known as dwarf valerian or small-fruited valerian, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered umbels of white or pinkish flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Valerianella microcarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and flies, contributing to its ecological significance.
